class.name: Word.CustomXmlSchema
class.description: Represents a schema in a [Word.CustomXmlSchemaCollection](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.customxmlschemacollection) object.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a CustomXmlSchema object to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application.

properties.name: location
properties.description: Gets the location of the schema on a computer.

examples.description: Get and display the file system location of the first custom XML schema in the document.

properties.name: namespaceUri
properties.description: Gets the unique address identifier for the namespace of the CustomXmlSchema object.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the namespace URI of the first custom XML schema in the document's schema collection.

methods.name: delete
methods.description: Deletes this schema from the [Word.CustomXmlSchemaCollection](/en-us/javascript/api/word/word.customxmlschemacollection) object.

examples.description: Delete a specific custom XML schema from the document's schema collection

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the namespace URI and location properties of the first custom XML schema in the document

methods.name: reload
methods.description: Reloads the schema from a file.

examples.description: Refresh a custom XML schema to ensure it has the latest data from its source file

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.CustomXmlSchema object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.CustomXmlSchemaData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a custom XML schema to JSON format for logging or debugging purposes

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a custom XML schema object across multiple sync calls to prevent InvalidObjectPath errors when accessing its properties after document changes.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get a custom XML schema from a part, use it to verify the schema namespace, then untrack it to free memory after you're done working with it.
